questions.question: Which of the following elements is a lanthanide?
Which of the following statements about the Aufbau principle is not correct?
options: Electrons fill orbitals starting with the lowest available energy levels before moving to higher energy levels
Electrons will not pair up in an orbital until all orbitals in the same sublevel have at least one electron
Electrons will always occupy a p-orbital before a s-orbital in the same energy level
The order of the orbital energies is often remembered using the Madelung rule
questions.correct_answer: Electrons will always occupy a p-orbital before a s-orbital in the same energy level

questions.question: What term describes the phenomenon where the electron shielding effect is less effective for elements in the d and f blocks, causing atomic radii to decrease despite an increase in atomic number?
Which of the following is not a type of intermolecular force?
In the compound FeSO4.7H2O, what does the '7' represent?
options: The oxidation state of the iron
The charge on the sulfate ion
The number of water molecules associated with each formula unit
The number of sulfate ions for each iron ion
questions.correct_answer: The number of water molecules associated with each formula unit

questions.question: In which type of solid is Frenkel defect usually found?
What type of isomerism is shown by [Co(NH3)4Cl2]Cl?
What is the coordination number of each ion in a rock salt structure?
Which element of the d-block has the highest melting point?
In the periodic table, which transition series includes the actinide elements?
